Must Haves
-1+ years as a Data Scientist
-Experience with Python
-Experience with SQL
-Masters’ Degree and/or PhD
Plusses
-Experience working on a Data Science Models, Marketing or Analytical project
-Working on call center data
Day-to-Day
Insight Global is hiring for a Data Scientist to sit 100% onsite in Stamford, CT/Austin, TX for a large Telecommunication company. This Data Scientist will be joining the Customer Operations team involved in analyzing call center data. Their main goals are to decrease call volume and prevent churn. One of the projects this individual will be working on is an ARC (at-risk Customer) based project which measures the amount customers call into the call center to determine how sensitive they are and if they will churn in the next 30 days. He/she will perform predictive modeling to predict who will call in the next 7 days with more than 50% chance of churn so that they can re-route the call accordingly to a special agent. This Data Scientist will also be working on the Chronical Caller Project in which analyzes the top 5% callers (frequent callers) to come up with a routing solution for them to prevent churn. In this role, the Data Scientist will spend approximately 40% of their time on SQL, 30% of their time on Python, 10% of their time working with IT, to productionize and 20% going on stakeholder meetings.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $60.00 - $80.00 per hour
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Education:
Master's (Required)
Experience:
Python: 1 year (Required)
SQL: 1 year (Required)
Work Location: One location

Role and Responsibilities
Cleaning, imputing, and augmenting data sets as required by specific applications to improve efficacy of ML models
Using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.) to manipulate and draw insights from large data sets
Deploying and managing data and ML models on AWS
Actively participating in internal and client meetings; Full ownership of data-specific tasks and presentation of those tasks to both internal team members and client
Qualifications
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (decision trees, artificial neural networks, GLM/regression, random forest, boosting, etc.) and their real-world advantages/disadvantages
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications
Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: Python, C++, Java
Knowledge of and experience with AWS services (ECS, DynamoDB, Lambda, etc.)
Experience working with and creating data architectures
Experience visualizing/presenting data for internal and client stakeholders: ggplot, Plotly, etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating with internal and client teams

Insurity's next Data Scientist

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

The Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned to:
Protect TikTok users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;
Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;
Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on TikTok platforms (e.g. TikTok, CapCut, Resso, Lark), covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc.

In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.

Responsibilities:
Build rules, algorithms and machine learning models, to respond to and mitigate business risks in TikTok products/platforms. Such risks include and are not limited to abusive accounts, fake engagements, spammy redirection, scraping, fraud, etc.
Analyze business and security data, uncover evolving attack motion, identify weaknesses and opportunities in risk defense solutions, explore new space from the discoveries.
Define risk control measurements. Quantify, generalize and monitor risk related business and operational metrics. Align risk teams and their stakeholders on risk control numeric goals, promote impact-oriented, data-driven data science practices for risks.
Bachelor or degrees above in computer science, statistics, math, internet security or other relevant STEM majors (e.g. finance if applying for financial fraud roles).
Solid data science skills. Proficiency in statistical analytical tools, such as SQL, R and Python.
Familiarity with machine learning or social/content online platform analytics. Bonus given to proficiency in modern machine learning applications.
Ability to think critically, objectively, rationally. Reason and communicate in result-oriented, data-driven manner. High autonomy.
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

Data, Research & Insights
The Music Expression team is focused on enabling creative expression through and around music by artists, aspiring creators, and fans. Our products are used at scale — over 1,000,000 active artists in Spotify for Artists, and more than 406,000,000 listeners.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our area. In this role, you will partner with our product teams to build the technology that makes our mission a reality by helping us to get to know our business better, understand what creators and listeners like, and help them create and find the right content.

You will work on defining a quantitative strategy and a system of metrics for our area, make sure we have the right instrumentation and data pipelines and set up and maintain monitoring dashboards. You will dive deep into our existing data to develop a behavioral understanding of our customers, as well as to forecast and predict the value that our tools & formats deliver to them & Spotify. You will work on metadata and features annotation that will help us understand the content being created better and make it easy to build ML models around it. In doing so, you will have a proven impact on making Spotify a platform where creative expression shines.

As part of the Product Insights team, you will partner with engineers, product teams, and designers to help us define the next generation of music expression products. You’ll also be connected to the broader Spotify insights community to expand the influence of your team's work.
What you'll do
Gain a deep understanding of how our tools & formats influence creator & user behavior by extracting insights from rich datasets to drive the Music Expression roadmap.
Help identify the most impactful opportunities for product development based on creator's & listeners' needs, and execute on them diligently and resourcefully.
Apply understanding of advanced machine learning practices to enhance product performance.
Partner closely with the other data scientists and data engineers to help inform, build and test hypotheses to deliver actionable insights to fuel our products.
Define the metrics we use to measure the health of initiatives and track them through dashboards.
Work closely with cross-functional teams of data scientists, researchers, product owners, engineers, designers, marketers, and others across the company who are passionate about our marketplace.
Mentor and coach data scientists and tackle leadership opportunities within the larger data science community.
Be an advocate for data-informed decision-making, making recommendations about the product performance and product experience available to the Music organization.
Who you are
4+ years of demonstrated ability in a similar data scientist role.
Degree in data science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or a similar quantitative field.
Significant experience with advanced statistical methods and machine learning.
Significant experience with product analytics, including crafting success metrics, running power analyses, determining statistical significance, and presenting findings with clear product recommendations or implications.
Previous experience working with a team of data scientists and data engineers building machine learning tools in production and at scale.
You have hands-on experience synthesizing insights from data using tools such as Python, R, BigQuery, SQL, Tableau.
Strong communication skills and value building strong relationships with colleagues and partners as well as the ability to explain sophisticated topics in straightforward terms.
You’re a compelling storyteller who can communicate in succinct and inspiring ways to audiences with varied data science experience to influence real world product or feature decisions.
Comfortable working with distributed teams across multiple offices and time zones.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.

For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

Your Job
This is a Senior Data Scientist position on our Ads Relevance team. Ads Relevance is a team of talented ML engineers, data and product scientists that are tasked with building the next generation of ad system intelligence. This team builds models and services that powers Enterprise ads ranking, bidding and targeting.
Responsibilities of this role is to build optimization ML models from end-to-end, as well as raising rigor of the modeling process for the whole team.
To help people get jobs it's crucial to model the value of jobseeker-employer connection to Employers - please come help us make this vision reality!

Responsibilities
Conceptualize, analyze, build, test, and implement models that utilize various and diverse data sets to solve problems related to the employment and recruiting industries.
Build and implement machine learning models, testing frameworks, and visualizations to make timely decisions and influence the product roadmap.
Proactively research data and identify opportunities in the data to drive the product roadmap.
Evaluate data’s big picture to solve business problems rather than focusing on metrics alone.
Understand human behavior and know what to look for in the data.
Communicate concisely and persuasively with engineers, product managers, and other functions. Helps identify ways to improve data quality and analysis. Utilizes a solid understanding of Indeed’s business fundamentals.
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing team here at Indeed.
Who You Are
BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a closely related quantitative field.
3+ years of industry experience, with expertise in Data Science or Machine Learning engineering.
Expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning.
Passion for answering Product/Engineering questions with data.
Strong ability to code in Python, Java, etc.
We get excited about candidates who:
Have full stack experience in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, productization, and monitoring of data science products.
Expertise in applied machine learning, preferably in advertising, auctions, bidding or pricing systems.
Experience running controlled online experiments and taking data-driven decisions for improving machine learning-based products. Preferably in non-independent settings, like marketplaces.
Can do small data modeling work: R, Python, Julia, Octave, Matlab.
Can do big data modeling work: Hadoop, Pig, Scala, Spark.
Can fish for data: SQL, Pandas, MongoDB.
Can deploy data science solutions: Java, Python, C++

We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for conducting advanced analysis of marketing campaigns from both structured and unstructured data to better understand marketing opportunities. Design, develop and evaluate advanced predictive and machine learning models with a focus on the optimization of marketing tactics and the guest journey within campaigns, products and events. Help refine media and owned tactics by using a variety of techniques, ranging from statistical analysis to complex data mining and modeling. Conduct advanced analysis on various marketing efforts to gauge performance, impact and effectiveness against the desired results. Deliver clear and compelling findings with data visualization tools and presentations that inform and inspire internal stakeholders to make better business decisions. Collaborate with colleagues in Marketing Operations and IT to infuse predictive analytics into customer touchpoints, driving increased relevance and business performance.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as a subject matter expert on developing and maintaining marketing mix attribution models for ongoing measurement of the incremental value of marketing efforts. Leverage forecasting and simulation-based modeling approaches to provide optimization recommendations of marketing plans.
Engage with internal partners to translate business problems into a framework for advanced analysis and collaborate to establish project goals and deliverables.
Define and produce deliverables that identify opportunities to tracking and measurement plans that inform and inspire internal stakeholders and decision makers.
Understands and actively participates in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training and team member involvement activities.
Performs other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION: Advanced degree (M.S., or M.A., or Ph.D.) in relevant quantitative field (e.g., economics, econometrics, computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics, data science, business analytics) required.
EXPERIENCE: 5+ years of prior hands-on experience in data science is preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Competency in programming with statistical modeling tools to fuel and deliver marketing personalization and business insights. Strong familiarity with manipulating and mining data to transform business decisions that impact the bottom line. Knowledgeable in leveraging visual analytics to create a seamless and inspirational story that inspire and inform business leaders with the necessary knowledge to drive revenue and customer loyalty.
Experience/Knowledge in the following areas preferred:
Travel & Resort Industry, Entertainment &/or Theme Park experience
Marketing Personalization
Marketing Mix Models, attribution, forecasting, and market testing
Digital Marketing & Analytics
Business Intelligence Reporting
CRM Execution
Consumer Research and Journey
Consumer Data
Competitive Analysis

Job Name: Machine Learning Engineer, Data Insights & Predictive Analytics - Ad Platforms
Job Description:
Summary
Posted: May 6, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200369495
At Apple, we work every day to build products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Search Ads in the App Store. Our platforms are highly performant, deployed at scale, and set new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy. The Ad Platforms Data Insights team is seeking a data scientist to join the Predictive Analytics Team in Austin, TX. The team is passionate about developing forward looking intelligence products for our marketplace. In this role you will work as a key member of a data-centric team to drive the exploration, analysis, development and execution of various solutions: revenue and opportunities forecasting models, understanding of user behavior and user engagement with our products, as well as finding ways of applying our findings and models through partnerships with other teams You will be tasked with discovering various patterns and trends in vast amounts of data and using these trends to advise business decisions. A successful candidate will have on-hands experience in various machine learning methods (particularly clustering and forecasting), ability to interpret results of analysis to drive business insights and forward looking decisions and ability to implement production-ready models. The role requires a broad knowledge of data mining algorithms, a strong eye for business, and creativity to invent and customize when needed. You’ll work directly with a broad range of data professionals and business leaders while using tools and methods to drive real-world business value. You will be a key player in a multi-functional team that delivers insights that have direct and measurable impact.
Key Qualifications
Hands on experience in quantitative analysis, including regression, classification, time-series, clustering. Ability to work with vast quantities of data.
Understanding of model development lifecycle from analysis and algorithm selection, to validation, and all the way to production implementation. Work efficiently with engineering partners on implementing your solutions.
Programming skills in Python and SQL.
Proficient with analytics tools such as R, Spark, and Tableau.
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner to influence the overall strategy of the product.
Experience in a data science role - preferably in digital advertising.
Description
- Support Executive team, Product, Marketing, and Partner. Development/Sales team by developing progressive view of product performance. - Become an authority on both the business and the data to drive new insights. - Develop variety of scalable predictive solutions and engage with other teams on facilitating usage of these models. Implement these solutions in production environment.
Education & Experience
Masters or Bachelors degree in a quantitative field of study including statistics, math, economics, operations research or a related field.
Additional Requirements
Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products.
Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.

We are searching for a Data Scientist – someone who works well in a fast-paced setting. In this position, you will harness vast amounts of data to optimize business results. Exercises knowledge of descriptive, predictive, and multivariate statistical techniques and applications, and database analysis tools and techniques, to develop strategic insights to drive business and clinical goals. Teaches developers, architects, and analysts how to work effectively with vast quantities of data. Provides data analysis and supports the development and implementation of advanced analytic tools to meet the needs of various groups within the organization. Works with a multidisciplinary team to design, develop, and create analytical solutions through applications of data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI), and emerging technologies. Collaborates with clinical and business users and other IS staff members to ideate and create new analytic solutions impacting patient care and hospital operations. Develops and implements descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics models, machine learning and artificial intelligence projects, and the front-end tools needed to operationalize the use of such models within the workflows of front-line users. Partners with subject matter experts to understand the relationship between workflows and data and uses that data to create information technology solutions that support and advance targeted outcomes. Provides data science and statistical support for advanced analytics projects within the Information Services department at Texas Children's Hospital. Analyzes and interprets clinical, operational, and other data to provide insight into care delivery and operational initiatives. Responsible for evaluating data quality, preparing data, generating insights, and developing and presenting high-impact data stories. Serves as a subject matter expert associated with data analysis processes, advanced analytics techniques, statistics, and meaningful data visualizations. Provides consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of complex data sources. Works on multiple concurrent projects

Think you’ve got what it takes?
Responsibilities
Creates data models and generates data insights
Generates and communicates business and clinical insights, using various techniques and understanding the strengths and risks of different approaches to data analysis
Analyzes large, noisy datasets and identifies meaningful patterns that provide actionable results. Data sources may include the Enterprise Data Warehouse, various source systems and databases, and data from external sources such as the Census Bureau. Source data may include both structured and unstructured data
Evaluates and communicates data quality within the context of the problem being analyzed, and implements appropriate data cleaning techniques when preparing data
Performs basic and advanced statistical analyses, modeling, interpretation, documentation, and presentation
Builds and tests statistical, optimization, and machine learning models, including regression, classification, clustering, natural language processing, deep learning, and/or statistical modeling. Applies best practices for data preparation, statistical methods, and approaches to data analysis to ensure valid and reliable results
Independently owns descriptive, diagnostic analysis of complex data problems, consulting with data architects and subject matter experts as needed.
Designs, develops, and creates advanced analytical solutions
Develops algorithms and predictive models to solve critical business problems
Owns full project life cycle from problem formulation to solution deployment and maintenance
Meets with subject matter experts to understand the business/clinical need and applies data science/AI/machine learning technology to solve real-world problems. Creates innovative solutions using creating problem solving
Works with project team to design features and develop advanced analytical models. Recommends and implements modifications to advanced analytics projects, analysis, and experiment design to ensure accuracy and validity, and to enhance model performance
Discovers new opportunities and solutions for problems by looking beyond current practices and using innovative thinking
Analyzes and presents data to help support the operationalization of new solutions.
Responsibility C: Communicates data insights and acts as a data storyteller by translating data analyses into easily understandable dialogue and terms to influence business decisions or actions
Presents clear and concise data insights, with recommended actions, in a format understood by non-technical clinical and business partners
Creates and presents engaging, high-impact data stories, utilizing narrative, context, and data visualization
Assists information users in understanding relationships between data, processes, and outcomes
Creates informative visualizations that intuitively display large amounts of data and/or complex relationships.
Provides statistical consultation
Provides statistical and advanced analytics expertise as needed to data architects, developers, project teams, and leadership team
Provides timely guidance and feedback to help other team members strengthen specific knowledge/skill areas needed to accomplish a task or solve a problem.
Plans, communicates, and manages risk related to tasks
Estimates time to complete individual tasks
Accurately communicates status on individual assignments and prioritizes to complete on schedule. Contributes details to the overall plan within your scope of expertise and skills
Raises any known assignment issues and risks immediately through the appropriate channels
Clearly and appropriately communicates ideas in writings, discussions, and meetings
Identifies the right discussion or meeting in which to communicate an idea, and orchestrates the most appropriate venue and approach to communicate the idea clearly.
Participates in overall analytics and application support delivery activities
Participates in the development and maintenance programming activities with management, other Information Services personnel, users, or vendors during all phases of the project life cycle
Adheres to the Texas Children’s Agile/Workload management processes and participates in daily team stand-up, Iteration planning and retrospective meetings
Qualifications
Being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, including any booster dose(s) of the COVID-19 vaccine recommended by the Centers for Disease Control when eligible, is required for all employees at Texas Children’s, unless approved for a medical or religious exemption.
Participates in the development and maintenance programming activities with management, other Information Services personnel, users, or vendors during all phases of the project life cycle
Adheres to the Texas Children’s Agile/Workload management processes and participates in daily team stand-up, Iteration planning and retrospective meetings
Company Profile
Founded in 1996, Texas Children’s Health Plan is the nation's first health maintenance organization (HMO) created just for children. We provide STAR/Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) to pregnant women, teens, children and adults in Houston and surrounding areas. Currently, the Health Plan has more than 375,000 members who receive care from our network of more than 1,100 primary care physicians, 3,200 specialists, and 70 hospitals. Texas Children's Health Plan is also the largest combined STAR/CHIP Managed Care Organization in the Harris County service area.

To join our community of 14,000 dedicated team members, visit texaschildrenspeople.org for career opportunities. You can also learn more about our amazing culture at infinitepassion.org. At Texas Children’s Hospital, diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the core of our values and mission for the women and children that we serve. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment for all faculty, staff and learners throughout our organization. We believe that each member of our one amazing team provides enrichment that allows us to create a lasting legacy for future employees of this great organization.

Texas Children’s is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants and employees are considered and evaluated for positions at Texas Children's without regard to mental or physical disability, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved.

Job Name: Data Scientist, Risk Data Mining, TikTok-US-Tech Services
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

The Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team of US Tech Service department is missioned to:
Protect TikTok users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;
Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;
Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on TikTok, covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc.

In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.

Responsibilities:
Build rules, algorithms and machine learning models, to respond to and mitigate business risks in TikTok products/platforms. Such risks include and are not limited to abusive accounts, fake engagements, spammy redirection, scraping, fraud, etc.
Analyze business and security data, uncover evolving attack motion, identify weaknesses and opportunities in risk defense solutions, explore new space from the discoveries.
Define risk control measurements. Quantify, generalize and monitor risk related business and operational metrics. Align risk teams and their stakeholders on risk control numeric goals, promote impact-oriented, data-driven data science practices for risks.
Qualifications:
Bachelor or degrees above in computer science, statistics, math, internet security or other relevant STEM majors (e.g. finance if applying for financial fraud roles).
Solid data science skills. Proficiency in statistical analytical tools, such as SQL, R and Python.
Familarity with machine learning or social/content online platform analytics. Bonus given to proficiency in modern machine learning applications.
Ability to think critically, objectively, rationally. Reason and communicate in result-oriented, data-driven manner. High autonomy.
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

We seek candidates for roles at multiple levels within the Decision Science team. The specific job level for an individual candidate will be determined based on their education, prior experience, and demonstrated technical and leadership proficiencies.

The Decision Science team focuses on creating innovative mathematical models to inform business decision making through data. The team is interested in all fields related to data science, with emphasis on statistics, operations research, econometrics, and machine learning.

The Decision Science team resides within the Disney Decision Science + Integration (DDSI) organization. DDSI provides internal consulting services for clients across The Walt Disney Company, including Disney Parks, Experiences and Products (covering Parks & Resorts, Signature Experiences, and Consumer Products, Games and Publishing) and Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (covering content from Studios, General Entertainment and Sports).

The DDSI team sits at the intersection of business strategy, advanced analytics, and technology integration to help our partners explore opportunities for analytics, shape business decisions, and drive value. Our work includes conceptualizing new solutions, solution design and development, implementation and integration with business processes, and ongoing business support.

Responsibilities :
Achieve business goals and objectives—Research and develop decision science models and act as a consultant to all business units within The Walt Disney Company
Pursue innovation—Conduct research on analytical techniques and translate that research into usable and sustainable solutions for users
Put your skills to the test—Perform data collection and data mining, and build state-of-the-art decision science algorithms, tools, and systems
Drive value—Model and analyze revenue management and pricing related issues using various mathematical, statistical, and simulation techniques
Tell the story—Present science results to business partners and clients
Support a global and enterprise-wide mission—Identify and apply best practices in the field of advanced analytics for multiple businesses such as theme parks and resorts (e.g. Walt Disney World), Disney Cruise Line, media (e.g. ABC, ESPN), movies (e.g. Walt Disney Animation Studios), live shows (e.g. Disney on Broadway), and retail (e.g. shopDisney)

Basic Qualifications :
Must exhibit competence in at least one of the following four analytical fields, inclusive of topics as noted:
Statistics (two or more topics):
Bayesian statistics
Generalized linear models
Mixture models
Nonparametric regression
Structural equation models
Time series (state space models, ARIMA, etc.)

Job Summary
The Department of Biostatistics seeks a data scientist with healthcare and public health informatics expertise. This position will design and direct innovative solutions for data products used in exploratory data analyses, generating and testing hypotheses, preparing and analyzing historical data, and identifying patterns. The data scientist will collaborate on extramurally-funded projects to offer innovative, expert-level Biostatistical and Biomedical Data Science expertise in study design and consultation in data analysis and interpretation after study implementation.

The data scientist will develop, direct and oversee implementation of project protocols that involve complex data systems, data linkage and capture, programmatic statistical analysis, data visualization. As a lead for data science, the position will actively promote and direct the service mission for biostatistics, data science, and biomedical informatics on a regional, national, and/or global scale.

Job Name: Data Scientist, Marketing, Measurement Operations, YouTube
Job Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: San Bruno, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience applying data science to business questions.
2 years of experience working with SQL and one or more of the following: Python, R, and C++.
2 years of work experience in a client-facing role.

Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Engineering, or Sciences.
2 years of experience working with one or more of the following: Statistical methodology, machine learning algorithms, data visualization.
Ability to craft engaging and compelling narratives in verbal and written communications for customers (including executive stakeholders) reflecting a nuanced understanding of diverse audiences.
Advanced root cause analysis, statistical, time-series and predictive modeling skills.
About the job
The YouTube Measurement Operations and Analytics team is responsible for ensuring that YouTube is represented fairly in third-party reporting tools, the internal data feeding those tools is accurate and consistent, and supporting business intelligence initiatives ranging from YouTube TV to YouTube Premium. We provide partner technical support, analytical services, and thought leadership to several initiatives shaping the long-term direction of YouTube.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
Responsibilities
Provide in-depth analytical support for external audience measurement partners.
Support internal partners for a wide range of data science initiatives by providing data analysis and modeling capabilities.
Identify, drive, and optimize new data science opportunities within YouTube’s operations organization and explain data-driven approaches.
Implement data pipelines, statistical, and/or machine learning modeling solutions in Python/R/SQL.
Convey analytical findings via verbal and written communications as well as data visualization for cross-functional/leadership audiences.

Job Name: Data Scientist, Marketing, Devices and Services
Job Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: New York, NY, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Bioinformatics, Economics) or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in marketing analytics, e-commerce product analytics, or related fields.
Experience with statistical programming (e.g., R, Python, etc.) and database languages (e.g., SQL).

Preferred qualifications:
Post-graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Bioinformatics, Economics) or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in marketing analytics, e-commerce, product analytics, or related fields.
Experience in analyzing large data sets and applying statistical modeling to solve business problems and deliver tangible results.
Experience in areas such as data analysis, survey design, and statistical modeling.
Experience with experimental design with the ability to apply statistical training to data.
Ability to initiate and drive multiple successful improvement initiatives inside and across an organization.
About the job
As a Data Scientist, you will refine business questions, identify the appropriate data sources, extract data, conduct quantitative analyses, define actionable metrics, synthesize information, and present insights to support marketing and product teams. You will solve business problems (i.e., site experience optimization, A/B testing, etc.) and deliver tangible results.
In this role, you will work with various cross functional teams to measure business performance and build actionable insights to grow the business.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Define metrics, measurement, experimentation and user understanding for Devices and Services.
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes specifying requirements, data collection and processing, analysis, presenting outcomes, and making business recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their business needs. Formulate and complete end-to-end analysis to identify growth opportunities.
Work with large data sets and solve non-routine analytical challenges, bring analytical aptitude and statistical methods to the challenges of measuring quality, improving consumer products, and understanding the behavior of end-users.
Lead and teach others and learn new techniques.

At Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK), we’re not only changing the way we treat cancer, but also the way the world thinks about it. By working together and pushing forward with innovation and discovery, we’re driving excellence and improving outcomes. We’re treating cancer, one patient at a time. Join us and make a difference every day.

Job Description:
Are you looking for impact? Do you want to use your skills to make the world's best cancer center even better? We are looking for a Junior Data Science Analyst to join our team!

We support our doctors, nurses, researchers, and other staff in the Department of Surgery (DOS) as they work to treat and cure cancer. Specifically, our analytical contributions include providing better access to our world-class surgeons, and improving patient care and experience while accounting the impacts on the entire health system.

If you have technical analysis skills coupled with a passion for applying it to solving real world problems that improve how cancer care is delivered, then this could be an ideal role for you.
We're looking for an experienced, out-of-the-box problem solver who is no stranger to using data analytics techniques for achieving operational and business needs. Someone who also enjoys professional development, trainings, and a healthy work-life balance.

Our team, Surgery Analytics, is a part of the DOS and Strategy and Innovation, a department in the front of MSK’s advancement, hosting novel and ambitious developments and projects. We have access to a sea of data: clinical, operational, financial, strategic, both structured and free text, all at our finger tips. The direct connection with DOS enables more insight to direct processes and what it takes to implement data science and operations research products.
You will:
Perform exploratory analyses and feature engineering on various types of data: numeric, categorical, and more.
Find correlations and dependencies between desired outcome data and various available data sources.
Train, compare and manage machine learning models
Show a commitment to implementing reliable models through CI/CD and API-development
Partner and integrate with engineering teams and executive leadership
You have:
2+ years of industry experience doing related analytics work
Work experience and a proven track record with R or Python and SQL
Must be comfortable with machine learning models
Written or contributed to APIs and R-packages or Python libraries is a plus
Healthcare experience is a plus
Benefits
Competitive compensation packages | Sick Time |Generous Vacation+ 12 holidays to recharge & refuel| Internal Career Mobility & Performance Consulting | Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA & Dependent Care|403b Retirement Savings Plan Match|Tuition Reimbursement |Parental Leave & Adoption Assistance |Commuter Spending Account |Fitness Discounts &Wellness Program | Resource Networks| Life Insurance & Disability | Remote Flexibility

We believe in communication, openness, and thinking beyond your 8-hour day @ MSK. It’s important to us that you have a sense of impact, community, and work/life balance to be and feel your best.

Best Buy Data & Analytics teams are working in a hybrid work model. Most roles can predominantly work from home but the person who fills this role will must be within a commutable distance to Richfield, MN, Seattle, WA, Atlanta, GA, or Boston, MA

As a Data Scientist on the Research & Development team, you’ll develop innovative applications of state-of-the-art statistical and machine learning methods in a scientifically rigorous manner, diving into large and complex data across the enterprise to answer the difficult questions that are foundational to driving real-world value by offering deep insight into every aspect of the business. In this role, you will have the opportunity to be involved in important strategic efforts to drive a data-grounded perspective, help Best Buy think critically and differently about all aspects of our business to improve our core capabilities, and unleash the next generation of customer experiences that will transform the way Best Buy operates day-to-day.

Join us if you want to spend your time:
Applying scientific methods to solve real-world business problems using data.
Utilizing cutting edge statistical and machine learning methods to dig deep into complex data to deliver data-driven solutions across all areas of the business.
Employing broad and deep knowledge of statistics, machine learning, and data science to contribute to and enhance Best Buy’s core data science capabilities.
Leveraging best practices from coding and software development & design to support building scalable, legible, and reproducible machine learning experiments.
Supporting & contributing to the development of highly scalable systems based on state-of-the-art machine learning techniques that provide batch and real-time scoring and inference as a service.
Working with business partners to identify the biggest opportunities to bring Best Buy to the next level and influence key decisions around real products that impact and improve the lives of millions of people.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a highly quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, Operations Research, etc) or equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of at least one focus area of data science (e.g. statistics, operations research, design and analysis of experiments, machine learning, quantitative analysis, etc).
Intermediate data mining skills with ability to leverage distributed processing to scale to big data - (do you know how to pull data? Have you used AWS/GCP to run your note books at scale?
Experience using generalized statistical and machine learning libraries (e.g. Scikit-Learn, Numpy, etc.).
Fluency with at least one data science/analytics programming language (e.g. Python, R, Julia).
2 years of experience contributing to development of ML and/or AI driven products or capabilities or other related functions (e.g. ML science or engineering, data science, advanced analytics). Advanced degrees in relevant fields may be counted towards experience requirements.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree or Ph.D in a highly quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, Operations Research, etc).
Experience using high performance machine learning libraries and/or deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow, RAPIDs, etc).
Experience designing & deploying ML experiment pipelines with, e.g., Kubeflow.
Experience using high performance machine learning and/or data mining frameworks.
Experience building distributed data processing pipelines (e.g. Apache Spark, Apache Beam).
Experience building scalable distributed products to implement batch, real-time, and streaming machine learning products.

Who We Are
Insurity is a leading property and casualty insurance software and data analytics provider, working with some of the world’s largest insurers, brokers, and MGAs, including 15 of the top 25 P&C carriers in the US. With 900+ team members globally, 10 office locations, and 300+ customers, we have a deep understanding of the insurance business, unparalleled technology expertise, and a singular focus of delivering a simplified insurance experience to our customers.
Insurity's next Data Scientist
Our Data Scientist will be an integral part of Insurity Analytics, working closely and collaboratively with insurance domain authorities, data analysts, engineers, and customers. They will develop highly robust predictive models that provide significant and measurable results for our customers. Additionally, they will partner with the sales and marketing teams to perform then deliver modeling proofs-of-concept & retro-tests, as well as help craft and deliver compelling product performance reads, product & concept education, and value proposition messaging.
What you'll do
Conduct sophisticated analytics activities demonstrating predictive modeling, machine learning, simulation, optimization, and other techniques to deliver insights or develop analytical solutions to achieve business objectives.
Optimally represent the Data Science group in a collaborative environment to complete company goals.
Support domain experts on efforts to develop scalable and robust solutions.
Translate sophisticated analytical and technical concepts for non-technical team members to enable understanding and drive informed business decisions.
Stay up to date on industry and job-related trends and standard methodologies, including reading relevant publications, articles, blogs, etc.
Who You Are
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Statistics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Mathematics or related quantitative field
2+ years of professional experience in an analytics role, focusing on statistical modeling or machine learning
2+ years of hands-on experience with R or Python
1+ years of hands-on experience with SQL
Strong ability to communicate sophisticated analyses and concepts to non-technical audiences within and outside of the organization.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and balance multiple priorities or tasks
Exposure to the insurance industry and concepts is a bonus
Location: This role will be Remote-US based.

Job Name: Machine Learning Engineer, Data Insights & Predictive Analytics - Ad Platforms
Job Description:
Summary
Posted: May 6, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200369495
At Apple, we work every day to build products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Search Ads in the App Store. Our platforms are highly performant, deployed at scale, and set new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy. The Ad Platforms Data Insights team is seeking a data scientist to join the Predictive Analytics Team in Austin, TX. The team is passionate about developing forward looking intelligence products for our marketplace. In this role you will work as a key member of a data-centric team to drive the exploration, analysis, development and execution of various solutions: revenue and opportunities forecasting models, understanding of user behavior and user engagement with our products, as well as finding ways of applying our findings and models through partnerships with other teams You will be tasked with discovering various patterns and trends in vast amounts of data and using these trends to advise business decisions. A successful candidate will have on-hands experience in various machine learning methods (particularly clustering and forecasting), ability to interpret results of analysis to drive business insights and forward looking decisions and ability to implement production-ready models. The role requires a broad knowledge of data mining algorithms, a strong eye for business, and creativity to invent and customize when needed. You’ll work directly with a broad range of data professionals and business leaders while using tools and methods to drive real-world business value. You will be a key player in a multi-functional team that delivers insights that have direct and measurable impact.
Key Qualifications
Hands on experience in quantitative analysis, including regression, classification, time-series, clustering. Ability to work with vast quantities of data.
Understanding of model development lifecycle from analysis and algorithm selection, to validation, and all the way to production implementation. Work efficiently with engineering partners on implementing your solutions.
Programming skills in Python and SQL.
Proficient with analytics tools such as R, Spark, and Tableau.
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner to influence the overall strategy of the product.
Experience in a data science role - preferably in digital advertising.

- Support Executive team, Product, Marketing, and Partner. Development/Sales team by developing progressive view of product performance. - Become an authority on both the business and the data to drive new insights. - Develop variety of scalable predictive solutions and engage with other teams on facilitating usage of these models. Implement these solutions in production environment.
Education & Experience
Masters or Bachelors degree in a quantitative field of study including statistics, math, economics, operations research or a related field.

We are searching for a Data Scientist – someone who works well in a fast-paced setting. In this position, you will harness vast amounts of data to optimize business results. Exercises knowledge of descriptive, predictive, and multivariate statistical techniques and applications, and database analysis tools and techniques, to develop strategic insights to drive business and clinical goals. Teaches developers, architects, and analysts how to work effectively with vast quantities of data. Provides data analysis and supports the development and implementation of advanced analytic tools to meet the needs of various groups within the organization. Works with a multidisciplinary team to design, develop, and create analytical solutions through applications of data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI), and emerging technologies. Collaborates with clinical and business users and other IS staff members to ideate and create new analytic solutions impacting patient care and hospital operations. Develops and implements descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics models, machine learning and artificial intelligence projects, and the front-end tools needed to operationalize the use of such models within the workflows of front-line users. Partners with subject matter experts to understand the relationship between workflows and data and uses that data to create information technology solutions that support and advance targeted outcomes. Provides data science and statistical support for advanced analytics projects within the Information Services department at Texas Children's Hospital. Analyzes and interprets clinical, operational, and other data to provide insight into care delivery and operational initiatives. Responsible for evaluating data quality, preparing data, generating insights, and developing and presenting high-impact data stories. Serves as a subject matter expert associated with data analysis processes, advanced analytics techniques, statistics, and meaningful data visualizations. Provides consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of complex data sources. Works on multiple concurrent projects

Think you’ve got what it takes?
Responsibilities
Creates data models and generates data insights
Generates and communicates business and clinical insights, using various techniques and understanding the strengths and risks of different approaches to data analysis
Analyzes large, noisy datasets and identifies meaningful patterns that provide actionable results. Data sources may include the Enterprise Data Warehouse, various source systems and databases, and data from external sources such as the Census Bureau. Source data may include both structured and unstructured data
Evaluates and communicates data quality within the context of the problem being analyzed, and implements appropriate data cleaning techniques when preparing data
Performs basic and advanced statistical analyses, modeling, interpretation, documentation, and presentation
Builds and tests statistical, optimization, and machine learning models, including regression, classification, clustering, natural language processing, deep learning, and/or statistical modeling. Applies best practices for data preparation, statistical methods, and approaches to data analysis to ensure valid and reliable results
Independently owns descriptive, diagnostic analysis of complex data problems, consulting with data architects and subject matter experts as needed.
Designs, develops, and creates advanced analytical solutions
Develops algorithms and predictive models to solve critical business problems
Owns full project life cycle from problem formulation to solution deployment and maintenance
Meets with subject matter experts to understand the business/clinical need and applies data science/AI/machine learning technology to solve real-world problems. Creates innovative solutions using creating problem solving
Works with project team to design features and develop advanced analytical models. Recommends and implements modifications to advanced analytics projects, analysis, and experiment design to ensure accuracy and validity, and to enhance model performance
Discovers new opportunities and solutions for problems by looking beyond current practices and using innovative thinking
Analyzes and presents data to help support the operationalization of new solutions.
Responsibility C: Communicates data insights and acts as a data storyteller by translating data analyses into easily understandable dialogue and terms to influence business decisions or actions
Presents clear and concise data insights, with recommended actions, in a format understood by non-technical clinical and business partners
Creates and presents engaging, high-impact data stories, utilizing narrative, context, and data visualization
Assists information users in understanding relationships between data, processes, and outcomes
Creates informative visualizations that intuitively display large amounts of data and/or complex relationships.
Provides statistical consultation
Provides statistical and advanced analytics expertise as needed to data architects, developers, project teams, and leadership team
Provides timely guidance and feedback to help other team members strengthen specific knowledge/skill areas needed to accomplish a task or solve a problem.
Plans, communicates, and manages risk related to tasks

Accurately communicates status on individual assignments and prioritizes to complete on schedule. Contributes details to the overall plan within your scope of expertise and skills
Raises any known assignment issues and risks immediately through the appropriate channels
Clearly and appropriately communicates ideas in writings, discussions, and meetings
Identifies the right discussion or meeting in which to communicate an idea, and orchestrates the most appropriate venue and approach to communicate the idea clearly.
Participates in overall analytics and application support delivery activities
Participates in the development and maintenance programming activities with management, other Information Services personnel, users, or vendors during all phases of the project life cycle

Company Profile
Founded in 1996, Texas Children’s Health Plan is the nation's first health maintenance organization (HMO) created just for children. We provide STAR/Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) to pregnant women, teens, children and adults in Houston and surrounding areas. Currently, the Health Plan has more than 375,000 members who receive care from our network of more than 1,100 primary care physicians, 3,200 specialists, and 70 hospitals. Texas Children's Health Plan is also the largest combined STAR/CHIP Managed Care Organization in the Harris County service area.

To join our community of 14,000 dedicated team members, visit texaschildrenspeople.org for career opportunities. You can also learn more about our amazing culture at infinitepassion.org. At Texas Children’s Hospital, diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the core of our values and mission for the women and children that we serve. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment for all faculty, staff and learners throughout our organization. We believe that each member of our one amazing team provides enrichment that allows us to create a lasting legacy for future employees of this great organization.

Texas Children’s is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Must Haves
-1+ years as a Data Scientist
-Experience with Python
-Experience with SQL
-Masters’ Degree and/or PhD
Plusses
-Experience working on a Data Science Models, Marketing or Analytical project
-Working on call center data
Day-to-Day
Insight Global is hiring for a Data Scientist to sit 100% onsite in Stamford, CT/Austin, TX for a large Telecommunication company. This Data Scientist will be joining the Customer Operations team involved in analyzing call center data. Their main goals are to decrease call volume and prevent churn. One of the projects this individual will be working on is an ARC (at-risk Customer) based project which measures the amount customers call into the call center to determine how sensitive they are and if they will churn in the next 30 days. He/she will perform predictive modeling to predict who will call in the next 7 days with more than 50% chance of churn so that they can re-route the call accordingly to a special agent. This Data Scientist will also be working on the Chronical Caller Project in which analyzes the top 5% callers (frequent callers) to come up with a routing solution for them to prevent churn. In this role, the Data Scientist will spend approximately 40% of their time on SQL, 30% of their time on Python, 10% of their time working with IT, to productionize and 20% going on stakeholder meetings.

Job Summary
The Department of Biostatistics seeks a data scientist with healthcare and public health informatics expertise. This position will design and direct innovative solutions for data products used in exploratory data analyses, generating and testing hypotheses, preparing and analyzing historical data, and identifying patterns. The data scientist will collaborate on extramurally-funded projects to offer innovative, expert-level Biostatistical and Biomedical Data Science expertise in study design and consultation in data analysis and interpretation after study implementation.

The data scientist will develop, direct and oversee implementation of project protocols that involve complex data systems, data linkage and capture, programmatic statistical analysis, data visualization. As a lead for data science, the position will actively promote and direct the service mission for biostatistics, data science, and biomedical informatics on a regional, national, and/or global scale.

Job Name: Data Scientist, Marketing, Measurement Operations, YouTube
Job Description:

The YouTube Measurement Operations and Analytics team is responsible for ensuring that YouTube is represented fairly in third-party reporting tools, the internal data feeding those tools is accurate and consistent, and supporting business intelligence initiatives ranging from YouTube TV to YouTube Premium. We provide partner technical support, analytical services, and thought leadership to several initiatives shaping the long-term direction of YouTube.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Implement data pipelines, statistical, and/or machine learning modeling solutions in Python/R/SQL.
Convey analytical findings via verbal and written communications as well as data visualization for cross-functional/leadership audiences.

Job Name: Data Scientist, Marketing, Devices and Services
Job Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: New York, NY, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Bioinformatics, Economics) or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in marketing analytics, e-commerce product analytics, or related fields.
Experience with statistical programming (e.g., R, Python, etc.) and database languages (e.g., SQL).

Preferred qualifications:
Post-graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Bioinformatics, Economics) or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in marketing analytics, e-commerce, product analytics, or related fields.
Experience in analyzing large data sets and applying statistical modeling to solve business problems and deliver tangible results.
Experience in areas such as data analysis, survey design, and statistical modeling.
Experience with experimental design with the ability to apply statistical training to data.
Ability to initiate and drive multiple successful improvement initiatives inside and across an organization.
About the job
As a Data Scientist, you will refine business questions, identify the appropriate data sources, extract data, conduct quantitative analyses, define actionable metrics, synthesize information, and present insights to support marketing and product teams. You will solve business problems (i.e., site experience optimization, A/B testing, etc.) and deliver tangible results.
In this role, you will work with various cross functional teams to measure business performance and build actionable insights to grow the business.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Define metrics, measurement, experimentation and user understanding for Devices and Services.
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes specifying requirements, data collection and processing, analysis, presenting outcomes, and making business recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their business needs. Formulate and complete end-to-end analysis to identify growth opportunities.
Work with large data sets and solve non-routine analytical challenges, bring analytical aptitude and statistical methods to the challenges of measuring quality, improving consumer products, and understanding the behavior of end-users.
Lead and teach others and learn new techniques.

Best Buy Data & Analytics teams are working in a hybrid work model. Most roles can predominantly work from home but the person who fills this role will must be within a commutable distance to Richfield, MN, Seattle, WA, Atlanta, GA, or Boston, MA

As a Data Scientist on the Research & Development team, you’ll develop innovative applications of state-of-the-art statistical and machine learning methods in a scientifically rigorous manner, diving into large and complex data across the enterprise to answer the difficult questions that are foundational to driving real-world value by offering deep insight into every aspect of the business. In this role, you will have the opportunity to be involved in important strategic efforts to drive a data-grounded perspective, help Best Buy think critically and differently about all aspects of our business to improve our core capabilities, and unleash the next generation of customer experiences that will transform the way Best Buy operates day-to-day.

Join us if you want to spend your time:
Applying scientific methods to solve real-world business problems using data.
Utilizing cutting edge statistical and machine learning methods to dig deep into complex data to deliver data-driven solutions across all areas of the business.
Employing broad and deep knowledge of statistics, machine learning, and data science to contribute to and enhance Best Buy’s core data science capabilities.
Leveraging best practices from coding and software development & design to support building scalable, legible, and reproducible machine learning experiments.
Supporting & contributing to the development of highly scalable systems based on state-of-the-art machine learning techniques that provide batch and real-time scoring and inference as a service.
Working with business partners to identify the biggest opportunities to bring Best Buy to the next level and influence key decisions around real products that impact and improve the lives of millions of people.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a highly quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, Operations Research, etc) or equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of at least one focus area of data science (e.g. statistics, operations research, design and analysis of experiments, machine learning, quantitative analysis, etc).
Intermediate data mining skills with ability to leverage distributed processing to scale to big data - (do you know how to pull data? Have you used AWS/GCP to run your note books at scale?
Experience using generalized statistical and machine learning libraries (e.g. Scikit-Learn, Numpy, etc.).
Fluency with at least one data science/analytics programming language (e.g. Python, R, Julia).
2 years of experience contributing to development of ML and/or AI driven products or capabilities or other related functions (e.g. ML science or engineering, data science, advanced analytics). Advanced degrees in relevant fields may be counted towards experience requirements.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree or Ph.D in a highly quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, Operations Research, etc).
Experience using high performance machine learning libraries and/or deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow, RAPIDs, etc).
Experience designing & deploying ML experiment pipelines with, e.g., Kubeflow.
Experience using high performance machine learning and/or data mining frameworks.
Experience building distributed data processing pipelines (e.g. Apache Spark, Apache Beam).
Experience building scalable distributed products to implement batch, real-time, and streaming machine learning products.

Machine Learning engineer/data scientist to work on interdisciplinary projects on the interface of neuroscience, cognitive science and Artificial Intelligence
If you are excited to work on the interface of neuroscience, artificial intelligence and cognitive science to understand the brain’s mechanisms of perception and cognition and engineer less artificial but more intelligent machines apply to join the laboratory of Andreas Tolias. We are seeking a capable and highly adaptable machine learning/data scientist to join a multi-disciplinary team of scientists and engineers working on large scale technologies for brain activity and connectivity mapping and to develop technologies to interface brains to intelligent machines.
The candidate will work in a team of scientists and engineers in developing new machine learning algorithms and data processing pipelines for the analysis of large scale brain data including integration of electrophysiology, function imaging, electron microscopy and molecular data.
The applicant will support a team of leading researchers in experimental neuroscience, computational neuroscience,and machine learning in an effort to discover algorithmic principles that bridge artificial and natural intelligence and to build brain machine interfaces. Our efforts will draw on state-of-the-art large scale neuroscientific physiological, anatomical and molecular data collected by a team of experienced experimentalists. This unique and ambitious collaboration has exciting potential for revolutionary discoveries in both neuroscience and machine learning. We invite applications from developers with various levels of field experience. Advanced degree may be substituted for field experience.
The ideal applicant will have the following characteristics:
- Is very experienced in scientific programming in Python (Main Requirement) and MATLAB (Optional)
- Experience in Machine Learning, data science and advanced image processing
- Experience with Deep Learning, PyTorch and GPU computations
- Experience in parallel, distributed and real time computations
- Understands basic software engineering and design principles for building and maintaining software solutions involving data acquisition, signal and image processing, data visualization and relational database.
- Is resourceful and possesses up-to-date knowledge about various software development and deployment tools including minimally Git/GitHub and Docker
- Is proficient at communicating with researchers from other disciplines
Additional non-required but desirable characteristics:
- Experience with Relational Databases such as MySQL (Administrative and Upkeep)
- Knowledge of Kubernetes
- Experience or interest in Neuroscience and cognitive science
- Interest in understanding the neural basis of intelligence and cognition
- Unity virtual reality system and Physics rendering engines

Job Profile Summary
ABOUT US
At bp, we’re reimagining energy for people and our planet. With operations working across almost every part of the energy system, we’re leading the way in reducing carbon emissions and developing more sustainable methods for solving the energy challenge.
We’re a diverse team of engineers, scientists, traders and business professionals determined to find answers to problems that must be solved. But we know we can’t do it alone. We’re looking for people who share our passion for reinvention to bring a new point of view, collaborative spirit, and to challenge our thinking in our ambition to achieve net zero!

ROLE SYNOPSIS
The staff data scientist role exists to bring thought leadership in the area of Data science and Machine Learning.

#bpdataanalytics
Job Advert
YOU ARE :
Able to apply established statistical and/or ML methods; Have significant knowledge and are the go-to-person across bp in areas of time series forecasting & dimensionality reduction. Know how businesses interact and how to engineer them to work better. Apply in-depth statistical methods and data science algorithms to make decisions and prioritize opportunities to drive commercial excellence through data. Bring significant business impact on one or multiple critical metrics; you are often approached by the business for your thought leadership
